title: How to Make Galaktoboureko

steps.headline: Heat milk, vanilla, sugar and cinnamon in a medium pan.
steps.description: when simmering, add the semolina in a steady thin stream, stirring or whisking constantly for 4-5 minutes or until thick and smooth. Beat in 2 tablespoons of the butter.

steps.headline: Allow to cool to room temperature.
steps.description: Beat in the eggs slowly until  smoothly incorporated. Put aside while you do the next stages. Melt remaining butter and keep warm.

steps.headline: Brush a medium sized (20 x 30 x 5 cm or 8 x 12 x 2 inch approx) baking  dish or lasagne pan with a little of the butter.
steps.description: Place one sheet of filo  and likewise brush with butter. Continue this process with 5 more sheets  using up half the remaining melted butter.

steps.headline: Top this layer with the custard.
steps.description: Beat the custard smooth if it had  firmed up as this will make it easier to apply to the pastry. Smooth the  surface and tap the pan very gently on the bench top to remove any air  pockets in the custard. Start to layer the remaining layers of filo pastry. Brush each layer  with the remaining butter.

steps.headline: Bake in a medium low oven - 170C / 340F for 35-40 minutes or until when  tested with a skewer or knife, that the custard has set cleanly.
steps.description: The  knife or skewer should be clean, just like when testing a cake.

steps.headline: Prepare the syrup while the galaktoboureko is cooking.
steps.description: Simmer the sugar,  water, lemon and spices for 5 minutes in a medium saucepan. When the Galaktoboureko comes from the oven, strain the syrup over the  pie immediately. Set aside to cool to warm or room temperature (about  15-20 minutes).

steps.headline: Serve portions cut into diamond shaped wedges, slices or squares.
steps.description: Garnish with vanilla ice cream, whipped cream and / or dust with cinnamon sugar.

text: Heat milk, vanilla, sugar and cinnamon in a medium pan. when simmering, add the semolina in a steady thin stream, stirring or whisking constantly for 4-5 minutes or until thick and smooth. Beat in 2 tablespoons of the butter. Allow to cool to room temperature. Beat in the eggs slowly until  smoothly incorporated. Put aside while you do the next stages. Melt remaining butter and keep warm. Brush a medium sized (20 x 30 x 5 cm or 8 x 12 x 2 inch approx) baking  dish or lasagne pan with a little of the butter. Place one sheet of filo  and likewise brush with butter. Continue this process with 5 more sheets  using up half the remaining melted butter. Top this layer with the custard. Beat the custard smooth if it had  firmed up as this will make it easier to apply to the pastry. Smooth the  surface and tap the pan very gently on the bench top to remove any air  pockets in the custard. Start to layer the remaining layers of filo pastry. Brush each layer  with the remaining butter. Bake in a medium low oven - 170C / 340F for 35-40 minutes or until when  tested with a skewer or knife, that the custard has set cleanly. The  knife or skewer should be clean, just like when testing a cake. Prepare the syrup while the galaktoboureko is cooking. Simmer the sugar,  water, lemon and spices for 5 minutes in a medium saucepan. When the Galaktoboureko comes from the oven, strain the syrup over the  pie immediately. Set aside to cool to warm or room temperature (about  15-20 minutes). Serve portions cut into diamond shaped wedges, slices or squares. Garnish with vanilla ice cream, whipped cream and / or dust with cinnamon sugar.
